meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sufficient.
meanings.sent1: Her sufficiency in solving math problems impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent2: We have enough food for the party; there is sufficiency.
meanings.sent3: His sufficiency in eating spicy food surprised everyone at the table.
meanings.sent4: The sufficiency of her knowledge shone brightly during the quiz.
meanings.sent5: The sufficiency of water in the desert saved their lives.

meanings.sent1: The sufficiency of chairs in the room made it comfortable for all.
meanings.sent2: He ensured there was sufficiency of paint for the entire project.
meanings.sent3: The sufficiency of jokes at the party kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The sufficiency of stars in the sky mesmerized the stargazers.
meanings.sent5: The sufficiency of time allowed them to finish the task without rushing.
